page.title: 15JESSICA VISITS A SAND QUARRY
page.content: We went to two quarries. We saw big pipes that sucked up the water and sand and we saw a man go out in a boat to move a machine that sucks the sand and water up and sends it in the pipes. Then it goes into a very big machine and that machine pours it out into big piles. We saw the sand fall down the piles. (In some quarries, if the sand depth goes below the natural water level, then a lake will be formed as the sand is dug out.) Once they sucked up a pike fish in the machine. Next we went to a quarry which was a "dry working" quarry. It was nearly the same but there was no pond that had pipes. The man told us that sometimes they find interesting things in quarries such as a mammoth's tooth and a Roman well containing pottery and fossilised shells. Nearly everybody drives a machine at work.
